title: 4Ts Score for Heparin-Induced Thrombocytopenia
description: Differentiates patients with heparin-induced thrombocytopenia (HIT) from those with other causes of thrombocytopenia

parameters.name: timing_onset
parameters.description: Timing: Time of onset of platelet fall

parameters.name: thrombosis_sequelae
parameters.description: Thrombosis: Presence of thrombosis or other sequelae

parameters.name: other_causes
parameters.description: oTher causes: Other causes of thrombocytopenia

ranges.interpretation: HIT probability <5%. Negative predictive value of 99.8%. HIT unlikely - consider other causes of thrombocytopenia. May forgo additional HIT testing.
HIT probability ~14%. Further investigation with laboratory tests for HIT (functional or immunoassay) is necessary. Consider discontinuing heparin until results.
HIT probability ~64%. Immediately discontinue all heparin. Start non-heparin anticoagulant. Perform confirmatory tests for HIT.

references: Lo GK, Juhl D, Warkentin TE, Sigouin CS, Eichler P, Greinacher A. Evaluation of pretest clinical score (4 T's) for the diagnosis of heparin-induced thrombocytopenia in two clinical settings. J Thromb Haemost. 2006;4(4):759-65.
Cuker A, Gimotty PA, Crowther MA, Warkentin TE. Predictive value of the 4Ts scoring system for heparin-induced thrombocytopenia: a systematic review and meta-analysis. Blood. 2012;120(20):4160-7.
formula: Sum of the 4 components: Thrombocytopenia (0-2) + Timing of onset (0-2) + Thrombosis/sequelae (0-2) + Other causes (0-2)
notes: Apply only to patients exposed to heparin with platelet fall
HIT type II is a serious complication that can lead to paradoxical thrombosis
Low score (0-3) has high negative predictive value (99.8%)
High score (6-8) requires immediate action: discontinue heparin and start alternative anticoagulant
Confirmatory tests include functional assays (SRA) and immunoassays (PF4/heparin)
Components: Thrombocytopenia, Timing, Thrombosis, oTher causes
